page.title: 09DORNIE POST OFFICE
page.content: The Post Office at Dornie serves the area of Inverinate, Sallachy, Auchtertyre and Dornie.It is not a sorting centre therefore any letters posted are sent to Kyle and then if necessary on to Iverness.The main business of the post office involves the payment of pensions and child benefit allowances as well as the sale of stamps.Previously there was much work in the purchase of postal and money orders as well as the sending of telegrams but this has been reduced. During July and August the post office is busy with tourists buying and sending post cards. The majority of customers are however local. With the removal of the sorting it has been possible to use the extra space for other goods such as wool, fishing tackle and greetings cards.
